    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        @POST
@Path("/add")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json;charset=utf-8")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addEvent​(EventData data,
                                          @Context
                                          javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
        This Java function adds an event to a Firebase Realtime Database and returns the event data in JSON format.
        Parameters:
        data - The "data" parameter is an object of type EventData. It contains the following properties:
        headers - The `headers` parameter is used to access the HTTP headers of the incoming request. It is annotated with `@Context` to indicate that it should be injected by the JAX-RS runtime.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Response object.

      • removeEvent

        @DELETE
@Path("/delete")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response removeEvent​(@QueryParam("eventID")
                                             java.lang.String eventID,
                                             @QueryParam("groupID")
                                             java.lang.String groupID,
                                             @Context
                                             javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers)
        This function removes an event from a Firebase database based on the event ID and group ID provided.
        Parameters:
        eventID - The eventID parameter is a string that represents the unique identifier of the event that needs to be deleted.
        groupID - The groupID parameter is used to identify the group to which the event belongs.
        headers - The `headers` parameter is used to access the HTTP headers of the request. It is of type `HttpHeaders` and can be used to retrieve information such as the authorization token, content type, etc.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a Response object with a status of "OK" (200).
